intro: Peucedanum spreitzenhoferi, commonly known as the Spreitzenhofer's angelica, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided lobes, and it produces small, white to greenish flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
